projects.name: Updating Data-Driven Models
projects.summary: Ph.D. Research (Jan. 2024 -- Present). Advisors: Michael Baldea, Brian A. Korgel.
highlights: Developed the Subset Extended Kalman Filter for online updates of neural network parameters to accommodate systemic drift or discrete changes in the modeled system. Reduces update time 2-3× compared to retraining all parameters.

Trained and maintained neural network models of parametrically drifting dynamical systems including a damped spring, CSTR, diabetic glucose-insulin, temperature control arduino, and fluidized catalytic cracking and fractionator system.
Sim2Real transfer learning of neural network models from simulated to physical systems.

Model hyperparameter optimization using Asynchronous Hyperband Search on Texas Advanced Computing Center's Lonestar 6 supercomputer. PyTorch implementation on GitHub: https://github.com/joshuaeh/Hyperband-PyTorch.

projects.name: Solar Irradiance Forecasting with Deep Learning
projects.summary: Ph.D. Research (Oct. 2021 -- Present). Advisors: Michael Baldea, Brian A. Korgel.
highlights: Developed a spatio-temporal deep learning model that forecasts solar irradiance up to two hours ahead using images of the sky and local meteorological measurements.

Reduced input data requirements by 12× while improving forecast accuracy using Conv-LSTM architecture to forecast future sky images, polar transformations to correlate satellite and ground-based images, and multiple-camera inputs.

Combined process systems engineering and machine learning by adding a novel-to-irradiance forecasting disturbance model to the forecasting model which decreased error when performing feature selection.

projects.name: Computationally-aided Photovoltaic Design
projects.summary: Ph.D. Research (Sep. 2025 -- Present). Advisors: Michael Baldea, Brian A. Korgel.
highlights: Used computational simulations to optimize the shape and size of groves in novel perovskite photovoltaic cells.

projects.name: Renewable Power Integration in Energy Systems
projects.summary: Ph.D. Research (Oct. 2021 -- Present). Advisors: Michael Baldea, Brian A. Korgel.
highlights: Developed a model-based net load forecasting framework that combines local building models in EnergyPlus, probabilistic weather forecasts from NOAA, and historical load data to forecast substation-level net load.
Optimized residential battery charge/discharge schedules to minimize electricity costs and demand charges using Pyomo and IPOPT.
Evaluated the effects of electric tariff policies on optimal battery sizing and operation.

projects.name: UAV Path Planning for Structural Monitoring
projects.summary: Undergraduate Research (Aug. 2018 -- Aug. 2021). Advisor: John Hedengren.
highlights: Flew UAVs to collect aerial imagery to evaluate and validate path-planning algorithms for 3D reconstruction of terrain and structures.
Helped develop novel autonomous flight-path planning algorithm that identifies where to photograph next based on current 3D model quality.
